Left midface elevation with nasolabial f.context: Left midface elevation with nasolabial fold elevation and nasolabial fold z-plasty and right symmetrization midface elevation.

nasolabial fold scar deformity with effa.context: Postoperative Diagnosis: Left nasolabial fold scar deformity with effacement of alar crease.

Left midface elevation with nasolabial f.context: Procedures Performed: 1. Left midface elevation with nasolabial fold elevation.

nasolabial fold z-plasty.context: We then turned our attention to performing the z-plasty portion of the case. A z-plasty was designed along the previous scar where it was padding to the notable scar deformity and effacement of crease and the z-plasty was then designed to lengthen along the scar to improve the contour.

right symmetrization midface elevation.context: Procedures Performed: 2. Left nasolabial fold z-plasty and right symmetrization midface elevation.

Less than 25 mL.context: Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 25 mL.

Coapt Endotine Midface B 4.5 bioabsorbab.context: Implants: Coapt Endotine Midface B 4.5 bioabsorbable implants, reference #CFD0200197, lot #01447 used on the right and used on the left side.

15-year-old.context: This patient is well known to the Stanford Plastic Surgery Service.

status post resection of the dorsal nasa.context: The patient is status post resection of the dorsal nasal sidewall skin cancer with nasolabial flap reconstruction with subsequent deformity.

nasolabial flap reconstruction.context: The patient is status post resection of the dorsal nasal sidewall skin cancer with nasolabial flap reconstruction with subsequent deformity.

effacement of his alar crease with deepe.context: In particular, the patient has had effacement of his alar crease with deepening of his nasolabial fold and notable asymmetry.

bleeding.context: Risks and benefits of the operation were described to the patient in detail including, but not limited to bleeding, infection, scarring, possible damage to surrounding structures including neurovascular structures, need for revision of surgery, continued asymmetry, and anesthetic complication.

infection.context: Risks and benefits of the operation were described to the patient in detail including, but not limited to bleeding, infection, scarring, possible damage to surrounding structures including neurovascular structures, need for revision of surgery, continued asymmetry, and anesthetic complication.

Dose of antibiotics was given to the pat.context: The patient was taken to OR and placed supine on the operating table. Dose of antibiotics was given to the patient.

Compression devices were placed on the l.context: The patient was taken to OR and placed supine on the operating table. Dose of antibiotics was given to the patient. Compression devices were placed on the lower extremities to prevent the knee embolic events.

50:50 mix of 0.25% Marcaine with epineph.context: Local consisting a 50:50 mix of 0.25% Marcaine with epinephrine and 1% lidocaine with epinephrine was then injected into the subperiosteal plane taking care to prevent injury to the infraorbital nerves.

symmetrization procedure.context: We then noted that he had improvement of the nasal fold but continued asymmetry with regards to improved bulk on the left side and less bulk on the right and it was felt that a symmetrization procedure was required to make more symmetry with the midface bilaterally and nasolabial folds bilaterally.

Endotine midface implant.context: We then released the periosteum distally just at the level of the nasolabial fold and placed our Endotine midface implant into the desired area and then elevated slightly just for symmetry only.

bioabsorbable screw.context: We then released the periosteum distally just at the level of the nasolabial fold and placed our Endotine midface implant into the desired area and then elevated slightly just for symmetry only. This was then secured in place using the bioabsorbable screw.

orbicularis muscle.context: We then continued closing our incision using absorbable plain gut 5-0 sutures for the subciliary-type incision and then continuing with interrupted 6-0 Prolenes lateral to the canthus. We then turned our attention to performing the z-plasty portion of the case.

alar crease.context: We then turned our attention to performing the z-plasty portion of the case.
